title: For Sale/Trade:  Kahr PM9 with crimson laser and Hi-Viz Sights extra mag.
postcontent:
This is a two tone KAHR PM9 with three mags, crimson laser, hi-viz sights and original Kahr case. $675.

I am the original owner of this gun. Bought it new about two years ago. When I first bought it, I fluffed and buffed it before shooting. (I do that to all my guns, even the mags.)

I have put 250 rounds of a combination of hardball, three different brands of hollow points, and a hand full of + P's through the gun with 100% reliability since day one. Kahr recommends a 200 round break in period. My break-in saves you about $80 in ammo alone.

Comes with extra 7 round KAHR mag (that gives you a total of three mags); Hi-Viz sights for fast daylight acquisition (Green front and red rear) and the Kahr PM9 crimson trace laser for night shots.

I have plenty of guns, so just decided to sell this one. $675 Cash.

May consider up or down trades for other guns.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ruger Security Six 2 3/4" 357 Magnum SS
postcontent:
$600 OBO, OBO!!!! This is a highly collectable Ruger Security Six 2 3/4" barrel 357 Magnum in Stainless Steel. This gun is in 99% condition, I say 99% as it is used but not much!!! No rust, scratches, or any other issues. It is flawless.

When I say highly collectable, first off it was made in 1975, this was the first year Ruger made this gun in Stainless Steel, also this is a PRE-WARNING revolver. In 1977 Ruger started put warning stamps on the barrel stating to read owners manuel etc... before using the gun. My gun has no warning, lastly it is the snub nose version made with a 2 3/4" barrel, these are alot harder to come by as the production numbers on these length barrels were very limited. It has adjustable sights as well. Try and find a 2 3/4" Pre warning in this condition, you wont, I searched two years before I found this one and it was a fluke, they are just not out there for sale very often???

I have a nice pair of Hogue Grips on the gun and I also have the original wooden grips, the original grips are mint condition. This gun has been fired very little and lockup is super tight and the trigger in single action is crisp, so crisp and light it is amazing. One of the best pistols I have ever owned and fired. Selling it to fund another project!

Lastly this gun comes with a handmade leather holster, this holster was special made for this gun and the two combine for a excellent carry piece.
This gun also comes with two Dade speed loaders and some ammo.

I will accept reasonable offers on this gun package. Additional pictures available upon request. Wichita area only FTF

postcontent: Up for sale is a 1979 Chevy Corvette. It has a 350 crate engine in it with 5000 miles on it with chrome valve overs and air cleaner, also has new turbo 350 transmission with same mileage. This Vette has the Gymkhana suspension package from the factory. This Vette also came with PL, PW, PS, and factory alarm system. Other options include the deluxe interior and factory positive traction rear differential with 3.42 gears. I just recently installed a AC compressor and converted it over to R134A, but it still does not blow cold like it should. I also just had a alignment done on it, fresh tune up and oil change. The car has headers with true dual exhaust with catalytic converters. This car has a fresh emissions test done on it, and passes with flying colors. I have also installed a Accel super coil for the HEI, and have a Weiand Stealth aluminum intake manifold that will go with the car, as will as a set of roller tip rockers and a Comp cams muther thumper cam. I have 3 different tops for the car which include a set of mirrored glass T-tops that are in great shape, a set of fiberglass T-tops that need to be painted to match the car, and a convertible style soft top. The car runs great and is in pretty good shape inside and out, especially for a 33 year old car. The paint does have flaws up close, and the interior needs some TLC. This is not a show car, it is a good looking driver but it will eventually need paint and interior work. Again this is not a show car, which is why it is priced the way it is. Serious inquiries only please, I do not have a lot of time and it costs money every test drive. I just had the original paint buffed and waxed, so it looks pretty good. The car has a pretty nice JVC CD player with MP3 and Ipod hook up. It is pretty fun to drive with a nice firm fast shift from the new transmission, and pretty good acceleration. This car actually gets pretty good gas mileage, but I also do not have a heavy foot. I am asking 4700.00 O.B.O for this pretty nice Corvette. I am also interested in trades of equal value. My name is Matt and my number is REDACTED. I am not in a hurry to sell so please no low ball offers. The only reason for selling is to many projects, so the room would be nice to have. They are, basically pieces of crap until you take the to a gunsmith to make them work right. Regardless of how few you've fired, the Bersa Thunder .380 has problems. title: For Sale:  Dan Wesson 15-2 Pistol Pack 357/38 Munson
location: Chapel Hill, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
For sale is a Dan Wesson Pistol Pack.  It comes in original hard case with original 2.5, 4, 6, and 8 inch barrels, both original grips, original tool, and original shim for setting the gap.  It has the original instruction booklet, and the warranty card which no one ever filled out.  It is a great gun with interchangeable barrels and grips that are simple and quick to swap out.  The most accurate revolver I own (also the longest barreled revolver at 8” and shortest at 2.5” that I own).  It has Munson stamped on the frame, so it was made while Dan Wesson was still owned by the Wesson family.  Serial number 27XXXX.  

I bought this gun with the intention of putting a new extra heavy slab side barrel on it and using it for carry, but after I shot it I decided it was just too nice for me to use and abuse.  There is a small chip in one of the grips which is shown in the pictures.  Other than that it’s in great shape for a 40somthing year old gun.  

Price is $1050, and I prefer cash, but am open to trades.  Here are a few of the guns I would consider in trade: Smith and Wesson revolvers (especially in 41 mag or 44 mag), decent 1911s, Colt Delta Elite, 41 magnum lever action, ruger sp101, kahr mk40 or mk9, maybe even a desert eagle or a 500 magnum, but who knows if you’ve got something interesting it can’t hurt to shoot off an email and ask.

Located in Chapel Hill.  You’ll need a copy of your concealed handgun permit or a pistol permit (which I will keep) and a bill of sale.  Obviously all laws will be adhered to, and I have no problem meeting and transferring the revolver at an FFL dealer if that makes you more comfortable.  

Email is the best way to reach me, it goes straight to my phone, so I will reply pretty quick usually.  Don’t hesitate to ask any questions.  If you want to see something that isn’t shown in the pics, just ask. Price is negotiable, but I'm not desperate to sell, it's a fun little gun and it won't hurt my feelings to be stuck with it a while longer.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Glock 20C Slide assembly
postcontent: I have a glock slide. The slide is 20C, which means that it is 10mm ammo. This means you get A LOT of power behind the bullet, but with that comes a large kick as well. The C in 20C shows that the barrel and slide are both compensated, which greatly reduces the kick. The slide has recently been inspected by a Glock specialist who said that it was not shot much at all as there is still some factory mark on it that says so. This slide has night sights installed on it. A Glock slide Is a very good find as no one will sell just a slide. The total price for this comes out to around 385 but the night sights were not professionally installed. I will send pictures through text or email. I will only deal with person to person transactions, and I am definetly interested in trading if you have the right thing.

title: For Sale/Trade:  WWII British Enfield SMLE .303 Lithgow Carbine. Trade 4 1911
postcontent:
This is a WWII Australian Enfield .303 SMLE Carbine made in the Lithgow factory and is dated 1941. I don't know if this is an original configuration as there were several experimental versions of this carbine. This is very possibly mfg from a long rifle. The wood and metal are exceptional for it's age. Most all the markings are Lithgow. I have many detailed pictures I will email to any serious interested parties. The bore is bright and shiny with no pitting. It will come with everything pictured including the WWI marked original British Enfield Leather sling (on the carbine), and web sling dated 1941 (same as carbine) which obviously saw combat. The lower/outer band is brass as is the buttplate. There is an original unused WWII pull through with brass end stored in the buttstock. One hundred rounds of non corrosive 174gr FMJ ammunition in WWII marked stripper clips in two WWII marked canvas bandoliers. There are also a couple extra Lithgow marked lower/outer bands (one with screw and sling swivel) and a couple extra stripper clips. 
This is a complete outfit and needs nothing. I am hesitant to let this go but I am looking for a 1911 but will consider all trade or cash offers. I do have a C&R and will ship to a C&R or FFL. I will only ship to a USA address.  Thanks for your interest.

30” barrel with permanent fixed choke. Front bead sight. The cool thing about this gun is that it has a recoiling barrel to assist in recoil reduction while out hunting. It’s only chambered for 2-3/4” shells. There is a removable brass ring that allows you to shoot high or low base shells without problems. The gun originally was made to only hold 3 shells but I professionally altered it so it now holds 5.

Gun has scratching at bottom on magazine tube where it gets loaded (as any shotgun does) and some minor wear marks on gun and stock. Very good condition for its age! Get yourself a vintage shotgun that works just as good as the new 1100 and 1187’s!

Looking to sell outright or use for trading for another gun that I may use more. Shoot me your offers and maybe we can work a deal!

title: For Sale:  Used Mossberg 500A 5+1 12 Gauge, 20 inch barrel
postcontent:
For sale is a used Mossberg 500A. It was purchased by me used about four years ago, and it looks to be from the late 80's to early 90's generation of Mossbergs. There are a few signs that this firearm has been well-used, such as a few wear marks on the blueing of the magazine tube where the slide makes contact with it (which is difficult to avoid with any shotgun over time), and two or three small scratches on the top side of the receiver.

Functionally, this gun is perfect, and has never failed to fire while it's been in my possession. It works exactly as you would expect a Mossberg to: reliable to the point of boredom. The action locks up tight, and the magazine spring is still strong. It feeds and extracts like clockwork.

There are only two modifications that I've made to it. First, it originally came with a 28 inch vent-rib modified choke bird barrel, and I had that cut down to approximately 20 inches by a professional gunsmith in Spartanburg, and re-beaded, in order to make it more suitable as a home defense weapon. As a result, the shotgun is now a cylinder choke. Second, I've drilled the bottom of the original walnut stock for a steel sling mount, which I'll be including in the sale.

This would be a great beater shotgun if you're looking to save some money over buying one brand new, or it could make a great home defense weapon. I'll also throw in a couple of accessories for this price: an Uncle Mike's nylon sling, and a 5-shot Neoprene shell holder for the stock.

Also, for an extra $20 or so, I have about 50 assorted Remington Express shells I'd like to see go with the sale. These are high-brass 2 3/4ths inch shells. I've got 20 1-ounce Sluggers, 20 27-pellet #4 buckshot shells, and 10 12-pellet 00 Magnum shells. This is my only 12 gauge, and I'll have no need for those once it's gone. These shells seem to retail for around $1 per.
